metadata.title: How to Use YouTube Analytics 2025: Beginner's Guide
metadata.description: Understand YouTube Analytics basics. Key metrics, where to find them, and what they mean.

hero.headline: How to Use YouTube Analytics
hero.subheadline: Data-driven growth. Understand what your numbers actually mean.

sections.content: YouTube Analytics tells you exactly how your channel is performing—but only if you know what to look at. Understanding your metrics helps you make better content decisions, double down on what works, and fix what doesn't. Here's your guide to the analytics dashboard.

content.title: Views
content.description: Total video plays. Basic but important. Shows reach.

content.title: Watch Time
content.description: Total hours watched. YouTube's most valued metric.

content.title: Subscribers
content.description: Channel followers. Growth rate matters more than total.

content.title: Impressions & CTR
content.description: How often shown and how often clicked. Thumbnail effectiveness.

sections.title: Navigating YouTube Analytics
content: Use date picker to compare periods

content.title: Average View Duration
content.description: How long viewers watch on average. Quality indicator.

content.title: Audience Retention
content.description: Where viewers leave. Find and fix drop-off points.

content.title: Traffic Sources
content.description: How viewers find you. Optimize for top sources.

sections.title: What to Do With Data
content: Track trends over time, not just daily

sections.title: Weekly Analytics Review Checklist
content: Watch time trend up or down?

faq.question: How often should I check analytics?
faq.answer: Weekly for trends, not daily for obsession. Daily checking causes anxiety over normal fluctuations. Focus on patterns, not individual data points.

faq.question: Which metric matters most?
faq.answer: Watch time and retention for algorithm. CTR for thumbnails/titles. Subscribers for community. All matter—but watch time drives recommendations.

faq.question: Why did my views suddenly drop?
faq.answer: Check if traffic source changed. Seasonal patterns. Algorithm shifts. One viral video ending its run. Usually temporary unless content quality dropped.

faq.question: What's a good retention rate?
faq.answer: 50%+ of video length is excellent. 30-50% is good. Below 30% needs improvement. First 30 seconds is most critical—hook viewers fast.
